books.title: Passages from the Life of a Philosopher
books.author: Charles Babbage
books.summary: The eminent Victorian scientist and mathematician on his inventions, dreams and adventures.

books.title: Bellarion the Fortunate
books.author: Rafael Sabatini
books.summary: An orphan develops his talents in intrigue, romance, and war in fifteenth-century Italy.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Mystery of Cabin Island
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: A group of amateur detectives unravel the mystery of a missing stamps collection.

books.title: The Cords of Vanity
books.author: James Branch Cabell
books.summary: An arrogant young author makes his way through a series of love affairs, avoiding every situation that may cause unpleasantness.

books.title: The Mule-Bone
books.author: Langston Hughes
books.summary: A guitarist and a dancer compete for the same woman’s affection.

books.title: The Gods of Mars
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: John Carter returns to Mars to try and determine the fate of his lost love Dejah Thoris.

books.title: Iola Leroy
books.author: Frances Ellen Watkins Harper
books.summary: As the Civil War rages, a young woman living the North is unaware of her African ancestry until she returns to the South and is immediately enslaved.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: Fantômas
books.author: Pierre Souvestre
books.summary: A shapeshifting arch-villain terrorizes Parisian society.

books.title: The Interesting Narrative of the Life of Olaudah Equiano
books.author: Olaudah Equiano
books.summary: An autobiography of an ex-slave in the mid 1700s.

books.title: Democracy and Social Ethics
books.author: Jane Addams
books.summary: Jane Addams argues that addressing social issues like poverty and inequality requires shifting from individual morality to a collective understanding of social responsibility.

books.title: Nonsense Books
books.author: Edward Lear
books.summary: A collection of literary nonsense in the forms of limericks, songs, and short stories.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: The Survivors
books.author: Tom Godwin
books.summary: A group of humans stranded on a deadly planet try to survive the harsh conditions and take revenge on the aliens that left them there.

books.title: School Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s school stories about the lives and adventures of schoolboys in the early 1900s.

books.title: Verses on Various Occasions
books.author: John Henry Newman
books.summary: A collection of poems by John Henry Newman.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
